avalancheActivity.comment:
The fresh wind slabs can be released by a single winter sport participant and reach large size in isolated cases. This applies in particular on steep slopes, and in gullies and bowls, and behind abrupt changes in the terrain. The prevalence of the avalanche prone locations will increase during the night.
Weak layers in the old snowpack can be released especially by large additional loads. Avalanches can also be released in the old snowpack and reach medium size in particular on steep shady slopes. Weak layers in the old snowpack are treacherous.
avalancheActivity.highlights: As a consequence of the moderate to strong northwesterly wind, snow drift accumulations will form.

snowpackStructure.comment:
As a consequence of falling temperatures a crust will form on the surface, in particular below approximately 2100 m.
The more recent wind slabs are bonding only slowly with the old snowpack, in particular on steep slopes, and in gullies and bowls in particular at intermediate and high altitudes.
Towards its base, the snowpack is faceted. This applies in particular on steep east, north and west facing slopes,.

tendency.highlights: The wind will be moderate to strong. Slight increase in avalanche danger.

avalancheActivity.comment:
From the second half of the night sometimes easily released wind slabs will form in particular in the regions exposed to the foehn wind. The fresh wind slabs can be released easily or naturally above approximately 2400 m. This applies in particular on steep slopes, and in gullies and bowls, and behind abrupt changes in the terrain.

Avalanches can also be released in the old snowpack and reach medium size in particular on steep shady slopes. These avalanche prone locations are difficult to recognise.
avalancheActivity.highlights: The fresh wind slabs represent the main danger.

snowpackStructure.comment:
As a consequence of falling temperatures a crust will form on the surface, in particular below approximately 2100 m.
Towards its base, the snowpack is faceted. This applies in particular on steep east, north and west facing slopes,.

avalancheActivity.comment:
Avalanches can be released in deeper layers, in particular by large additional loads. These can reach medium size. Weak layers in the old snowpack are difficult to recognise.
At low and intermediate altitudes thus far only a little snow is lying. Watch out for the numerous rocks hidden by the little recent snow.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Isolated avalanche prone weak layers exist in the old snowpack. Weak layers in the old snowpack are difficult to recognise.

snowpackStructure.comment:
As a consequence of falling temperatures a crust will form on the surface, in particular below approximately 2100 m.
In some places new snow is lying on a hard crust.
At low altitude less snow than usual is lying.
Watch out for the numerous rocks hidden by the little recent snow.

avalancheActivity.comment:
In some places new snow is lying on the smooth surface of an old snowpack.
Avalanches can as before be released by large loads, but they will be small in most cases.
The avalanche prone locations are to be found in particular in gullies and bowls above approximately 2200 m and at transitions from a shallow to a deep snowpack.
Watch out for the numerous rocks hidden by the little recent snow.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Individual avalanche prone locations for dry avalanches are to be found in particular on very steep slopes above approximately 2200 m.

snowpackStructure.comment:
Over a wide area new snow and wind slabs are lying on a hard crust.
As a consequence of falling temperatures a crust will form on the surface, in particular below approximately 2100 m.
At low altitude less snow than usual is lying.
